author: TNN
title: Rainfall Warning: Heavy rain alert in Kerala till Saturday | - Times of India
text: Kochi: The IMD has issued a heavy rainfall warning for Kerala till Saturday. Malappuram, Kozhikode, Wayanad, Kannur and Kasaragod are on yellow alert on Friday, while Kannur and Kasaragod are on alert on Saturday. Squally weather conditions are expected, with wind speeds reaching 35-45 kmph and gusting up to 55 kmph over the Gulf of Mannar, South TN coast and adjoining Comorin area, East Central Arabian Sea, adjoining parts of Westcentral Arabian Sea, southwest Bay of Bengal, Southeast Bay of Bengal, Central Bay of Bengal, and North Bay of Bengal.Fishermen are advised to avoid venturing into these sea areas.INCOIS has issued a high wave alert for Kannur, Kasaragod, Kollam, and Thiruvananthapuram.According to 24-hour rainfall recorded on Thursday morning, Vadakara recorded 11cm of rain, while Kannur, Mahe and Muliyar got 8cm. Taliparamba and Padannakkad got 7 cm rainfall and Karipur airport, Hosdurg, Kudulu and Peringome got 6cm rainfall. We also published the following articles recentlyStrong winds, heavy rains continue to batter KannurKannur experienced severe disruption due to heavy rain and strong winds, damaging 320 houses and causing widespread power outages. Around 2,000 electric posts collapsed, affecting the power supply of 3 lakh customers. Authorities reported significant crop damage and vehicular destruction. Yellow alerts have been issued for several districts in north Kerala till July 30, warning of continued adverse weather conditions.112050024Delhi schools closed on Thursday due to heavy rainfall; IMD warns of continued heavy rains till August 5Delhi's education minister Atishi announced that all schools in the national capital, both government and private, would remain closed on Thursday due to heavy rainfall leading to waterlogging. The India Meteorological Department predicted continued rain until August 5, causing flight disruptions and prompting officials to stay vigilant in waterlogging-prone areas, including locations with coaching centers.112176704Gurgaon: IMD issues alert for heavy rain on weekend, max temperature dipsThe India Meteorological Department issued a yellow alert for heavy rainfall in Gurgaon within 24 hours. Friday's maximum temperature dipped slightly to 34 degrees Celsius, while the minimum rose to 27.9 degrees. In Delhi, moderate to heavy rain varied across areas, leading to a dip in temperature. The air quality remains satisfactory.112055042
